member.summary: Estimates the CWT for the specified signal using the convolution method.

member.name: T:Neuronic.TimeFrequency.Transforms.EmpiricalModeDecomposition
member.summary: Empirical Mode Decomposition (EMD) in Intrinsic Mode Functions (IMF).
Estimates the EMD of the specified signal.
member.param: The stop criteria of the outer loop. Default is .
The stop criteria of the inner loop, responsible for obtaining each IMF. Default is .
Gradient step size, in the range (0, 1].
member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the work of Rato, R. T., Ortigueira, M. D. and Batista, A. G., published in the article "On the HHT, its problems, and some solutions", Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing , vol. 22, no. 6, pp. 1374-1394, August 2008.

member.summary: Estimates the EMD of the specified signal.
member.param: The stop criteria of the outer loop.
The stop criteria of the inner loop, responsible for obtaining each IMF.
Gradient step size, in the range (0, 1].
member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the work of Rato, R. T., Ortigueira, M. D. and Batista, A. G., published in the article "On the HHT, its problems, and some solutions", Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing , vol. 22, no. 6, pp. 1374-1394, August 2008.

member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the method proposed by Rato, R. T., Ortigueira, M. D. and Batista, A. G. in the article "On the HHT, its problems, and some solutions", Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing , vol. 22, no. 6, pp. 1374-1394, August 2008.

The number of overlapped samples between consecutive window offsets.
member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the spectrogram function in Matlab R2014.

member.name: M:Neuronic.TimeFrequency.Transforms.Spectrogram.Estimate(Neuronic.TimeFrequency.IReadOnlySignal{System.Single},System.Double[],System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Threading.Tasks.ParallelOptions)
member.summary: Estimates the Spectrogram of the specified signal using the STFT algorithm.
member.param: The window. Default to hamming window.
The number of overlapped samples between consecutive window offsets.
member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the spectrogram function in Matlab R2014.

member.name: T:Neuronic.TimeFrequency.Transforms.TimeFrequencyDistribution
member.summary: Time-Frequency distribution (TFD).

member.name: M:Neuronic.TimeFrequency.Transforms.TimeFrequencyDistribution.Estimate(Neuronic.TimeFrequency.IReadOnlySignal{System.Double},Neuronic.TimeFrequency.Kernels.DopplerLagKernel,System.Threading.Tasks.ParallelOptions)
member.summary: Estimates the TFD of the specified signal.
member.exception: Thrown when either the signal or the kernel are null.
member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the one proposed by J.M. O' Toole and B. Boashash on the article "Fast and memory-efficient algorithms for computing quadratic timefrequency distributions", Applied and Computational Harmonic Analysis, vol. 35, no. 2, pp. 350358, 2013.

member.summary: Estimates the TFD of the specified signal.
member.exception: Thrown when either the signal or the kernel are null.
member.remarks: This algorithm is based on the one proposed by J.M. O' Toole and B. Boashash on the article "Fast and memory-efficient algorithms for computing quadratic timefrequency distributions", Applied and Computational Harmonic Analysis, vol. 35, no. 2, pp. 350358, 2013.
